full_text: A powerful morning at Centennial Baptist Church in Mexico, celebrating the #NationalDayofPrayer. A quiet moment of worship together, and a reminder that the faith of our citizens is part of what makes Missouri and America so strong. Joshua 1:9

Today, we signed an executive order to ensure Missouri’s Homeland Security Advisory Council has every resource to keep Missourians safe. The expanded council will be more empowered to plan responses to natural disasters and terrorist threats, and enforce our immigration laws. https://t.co/GKYz3pJxUd
Great meeting with young people from across Missouri to talk about public service—a really positive and productive morning. https://t.co/lmvsprBzjS

Fantastic weekend in Hickory and Texas counties talking about the conservative reforms we’ve fought for, the results we’ve achieved, and our mission to win more quality jobs for Missouri families. https://t.co/ea76flm4BR

We've been working hard to protect our veterans and ensure they get quality care. Today, I met with the new administrator of the St. Louis Veterans Home to talk about their work to do better for veterans. Solid progress so far--know they will continue to improve. https://t.co/cZ398SWKWv
Great talking with @MissouriChamber’s next generation of leaders about how to bring more quality jobs to Missouri today. https://t.co/zvbwEyEvl3
This team is getting great results for the people of Missouri. Met with cabinet leaders today to discuss their achievements and strategic goals. https://t.co/D6xRE00Dkz

I will not be resigning the Governor's office. In three weeks, this matter will go to a court of law—where it belongs and where the facts will prove my innocence. Until then, I will do what the people of Missouri sent me here to do: to serve them and work hard on their behalf.

Today is #TaxDay: Last year in March, only 35% of calls to Missouri’s tax call center got answered. We said that’s unacceptable, and this year it’s up to more than 90%. Stopped by to thank some workers on the phones today for helping Missourians. We’re working to get it to 100%! https://t.co/fiu5o3o40G
Great weekend with Republicans in Platte and Buchanan counties! These crowds were fired up, because conservative reforms in Missouri are getting results. https://t.co/VG9Ij0ijMW

Circuit Attorney Kim Gardner hid a video that she knew directly contradicted allegations in the House report, and she allowed her lead investigator to lie about it, under oath. https://t.co/PSKGWAFe9i

I was honored to participate in the Purple Heart ceremony for Dewayne “Preacher” Cunningham today in Mt. Vernon. He was wounded during the Vietnam War. Today, we got to say what too many soldiers from that war never heard: “Thank you for your service.” God bless our veterans! https://t.co/MuHawXEMFd
Congrats @UCMWBB! National Champions! #TeamUCM

Quick reminder for anyone who thinks food comes from the grocery store: thank a farmer! It's National Agriculture Week!

We signed a proclamation honoring our farmers with FFA students in Kingdom City. Thanks to all of you for what you do! https://t.co/sysgNfDXSg
Thoughts and prayers for the family and friends of Rep. Cloria Brown, a dedicated public servant who passed yesterday.

Great conversation with veterans in Troy today. These guys get together once a week to drink coffee and swap stories. Great way to start the day--out with the people we're fighting for! https://t.co/fxMEF1inKa

Elijah does fantastic work for the people of Missouri every day. He is a friend, a great member of our team, and an incredible advocate for the Down Syndrome community. I was honored to ask him to accept an appointment to serve on the Governor's Council on Disability. https://t.co/WdImZAE2M4
We promised to bring American jobs back to Southeast Missouri. We fought for them, and we won! Those jobs are coming back! https://t.co/tH0vLbjcmx

After a special session and a lot of work by people all over the state and country, I was proud to be back in the bootheel today to announce that an aluminum smelter is opening with 450 quality jobs!  We’re winning the fight for more jobs and higher pay in Missouri. https://t.co/olZVJ4Iy0u
Last year, the people of Southeast Missouri came together with one voice to say: we don't want welfare. We want to work. Bring back American jobs. https://t.co/lFVyFL7Wn1
Amazon is bringing 1,500 full-time jobs to St. Peters! We’re keeping our promises and competing for quality jobs for Missourians. https://t.co/dy4TfQlsDM
The department has lost two officers this year. Clinton is grieving, and the entire state of Missouri stands with them. Prayers for this town and this department.

Our love, our thoughts, and our prayers go to the Clinton police department and the family of Officer Ryan Morton this morning. Officer Morton was shot and killed in the line of duty last night. Two more officers were also shot.

Ever watch someone walk right up to a 280 lb. Mama Black Bear guarding her cubs? I saw it today. Pretty crazy. We went to Howell County to spend the morning with state workers on the Black Bear Project. Awesome to see the work of our conservation team. https://t.co/xaAsknq21T

We fought hard to bring quality jobs back to this community, and now I'm excited to join the people of New Madrid again for a major jobs announcement on Friday! https://t.co/3emem790Kq https://t.co/7yMKwrubGO

Yesterday, we announced a new effort to hold Medicaid providers who prescribe too many opioids, and refuse to change their ways, accountable for their actions. The people who push unnecessary pills are ruining lives, and we’re working to stop it.

https://t.co/2WQDIJGQ4L

Today, we met with families and responders coming together to recover after the tornado in Southeast MO. This is a resilient community. In the face of serious danger and damage, the faith, strength, and spirit of the community is unbroken. https://t.co/nEnfd7y2Ox

Saddened to hear that Reverend Billy Graham, a man who spent his life serving others and a purpose larger than this world, has passed. He will be missed by millions whose lives were touched by his service.

We’re ending special interest rip-offs and putting more money back in your pocket with tax cuts for working families. 

We stood strong with 300 workers in St. Joseph yesterday, and we’re proud to be fighting for working families across Missouri. https://t.co/vsYO7BQRvG

We don’t want leaders of terrorist organizations in MO, and Hamed does not deserve the privilege of citizenship. When you support terrorism, commit crimes, and lie about your ties to terror in the process of becoming a citizen—you need to lose your citizenship and be deported.
Hamed went through the naturalization process to become a US citizen and lied under oath about his ties to this terrorist organization and the crimes he committed.

Hamed ran an organization called the Islamic American Relief Agency, based here in Columbia, Missouri. The U.S. government classified it as a terrorist organization when it was discovered that the group funneled over one million dollars to Iraq in violation of federal law.

Mubarak Hamed was the leader of a Missouri-based terrorist organization and is a convicted criminal who lied his way through the immigration process. @TheJusticeDept wants his citizenship revoked—and they're right.
Special interests have been ripping you off for years. We put an end to it and we’re putting more money back in your pocket. https://t.co/JYPi3l2cPa
Thanks to @NickBSchroer for your work on Veterans Hiring Preferences! You’re making a difference for a lot of brave men and women coming home to Missouri looking for a new mission.

Missouri companies are growing again! 300 new jobs announced today in Audrain County, St. Louis, Birmingham and Kansas City. Tax reform will help us win even more jobs and help more Missouri businesses grow.
Champ is a fighter. He’s recovered from his wounds, and he’s back on duty. We’re grateful for him and for the men and women of law enforcement. https://t.co/W1Qzma7IKB

We need to strengthen Missouri’s laws. These K-9s do incredible work on behalf of our people. They are trained, tough dogs. They help keep Missourians safe. There’s a bill to do that working its way through the legislature now. It’s called “Champ’s Law.” It’s a bill I support.
In Iowa, if you hurt a police animal, you can go to jail for up to five years. If you hurt an FBI dog, you can go to jail for up to 10 years. https://t.co/qVvlZEICsQ

Last month, Champ was stabbed in the side of the neck while pursuing a suspect.

In Missouri, stabbing a police K-9 carries about the same penalty as not returning a library book.

That’s not right. https://t.co/lGriAC3nXn

Today, after some meetings in KC, I stopped by for a workout with some Kansas City police officers. We were joined by guys from the Cass County Sheriff’s office—and Champ. He’s a German Shepherd who has been with the Cass County Sheriff’s office for four years. https://t.co/aqzVDqegGF
Great discussions with business leaders in Kansas City today about how we can create and attract more jobs. Missouri is open for business! https://t.co/p762FbOIDp

Great news: we found another 86 government cars that weren't needed, and we're getting rid of them! $2.2 million of your tax dollars saved. Amazing what can be accomplished with some common sense. It's your money and we're making sure the government doesn't waste a cent of it. https://t.co/ZIEPMdYAcu
This is the boldest state tax reform in America because it's tax reform for working families--not lobbyists and special interests. https://t.co/ZULAoh3y3b https://t.co/WQvFVc6aOj
Thanks to the Missouri Senate for confirming three of our directors today. They’re doing great work for our state, and helping to win jobs for Missourians! @MoDOLIRDirector @DixonRob @SteveCorsi

We’re getting the government off people's backs. We're conducting the most aggressive, most ambitious, most detailed effort to roll back unnecessary regulations in the United States. https://t.co/yduv1BjEpl

We are working for every single Missourian. That's why today we're announcing a joint initiative between the Department of Economic Development and Department of Agriculture to get broadband access to our rural communities. https://t.co/cI1wwgTSrs
An additional statement from Sheena https://t.co/rG92sVqp9M
Joint Statement from Sheena and I https://t.co/t3DT6V0Gba
Statement from James F. Bennett, our attorney https://t.co/l4VreENKRT
I wanted to share with you some statements that are important in light of news you may have seen tonight.
God bless you, and God bless the people of Missouri. https://t.co/T2vdqqsInz
We promised the people of Missouri that we would fight for the least among us, the counted out, and the forgotten. We have, and we will.
We promised the people of Missouri that we would fight for them. We have, and we will.
We want Missouri to be the best state in the country for veterans and military families.
https://t.co/0vU859lVja
This year, we need to pass legislation that protects the health, safety, and well-being of our firefighters, police officers, and other first responders.
We promised the people of Missouri that we would support our law enforcement officers and first responders, and that’s what we’ve done.
This year, both bodies need to get together and pass a ban on gifts from lobbyists to the legislature.
https://t.co/ET3Y0Buzhx
To serve citizens well, government needs to do fewer things and do them better.

We pay attention to dollars, and we pay attention to cents, because we remember: every single dollar this government spends was earned by the hard work of a Missourian, and this is the people’s money. https://t.co/Maiz9Q6P3R
Today the government of the state of Missouri is the smallest it’s been in two decades.
https://t.co/z9vE6G57Gx
Last year, we faced a choice: we could cut spending or raise taxes. I’m proud to say that we cut spending, and we did not raise taxes on the citizens of Missouri a single nickel.
One of the best investments we can make in Missouri, is also one of the most straightforward: cut taxes and put money back into the pockets of the people of Missouri.
We are taking nearly one out of every three regulatory requirements in the state of Missouri—that’s 33,000 regulatory requirements—off the books for good. https://t.co/28xrl5J6Sj

When we came into office, we looked at the burden of regulations and red tape on our farms, businesses, homes, neighborhoods, & communities. We had almost 7,000 regulations & 112,000 regulatory requirements on the books, adding up to more than seven million words in total.
https://t.co/KpmlsJnvZQ

Every child in the Missouri foster care system has seen more than their fair share of hardship. We need to see in them their God-given potential, and we need to do everything in our power to help them to fulfill it.
Our team has been working with members of this body on twenty legislative initiatives to help children in need.
Some of the people who need us most, who are counting on us, are the children in the Missouri foster care system, all 13,000 of them.
https://t.co/vWaDAsUR2E
https://t.co/NSNT6GEcb0
Over the past year, we have devoted the energy and attention of our office to putting Missourians back to work.
https://t.co/skkxPsi7Co
https://t.co/AZMt5vozK5
We Missourians know that the contributions that have counted most have often come from people who were, at one time, counted out.
At 7 PM, I’ll be speaking with Missourians about the state of the state. You can watch live from our Facebook page here: https://t.co/KWRExQixOx https://t.co/P94zM6bB3T

You work too hard to have your money wasted by government. We found 30 government cars that weren’t being used. So, we’re getting rid of them. We’re saving you $500,000. Common sense. https://t.co/mKVyHfjTtT
Proud to be fighting for Missouri's most vulnerable kids with @SheenaGreitens. They deserve our love and support. https://t.co/7h0jOShqGc

quoted_status.full_text: 6 Sens. recused themselves from voting — 4 Ds, 2 Rs. If rest of Ds allowed to recuse themselves, no 2/3 majority, raises go through #moleg

full_text: Missourians are tightening their belts and living within their means. Politicians are trying to vote themselves raises. Typical, and awful.
We need more jobs and higher pay for Missourians, not for politicians. This pay increase for politicians must be stopped. #moleg
The last thing we need to do is to give politicians a pay increase. This needs to be stopped. #moleg
Call your senator now and tell them to stop this outrageous pay increase for politicians. https://t.co/nj0STiFKug #moleg
Politicians in our Senate are now considering a pay raise. This is outrageous. They need to stand up & stop this pay raise for politicians.

quoted_status.full_text: Thank you all for your well wishes & prayers. I'm feeling great & getting stronger every day. Look forward to seeing everyone on Jan 9th!

full_text: Happy New Year! Excited about opportunity we have -will be tough fight, but together, we'll end politics as usual & take MO in new direction
